word: IT SEEMS CLEAR FROM THE CONTEXT ITSELF AND FROM THE AUTHOR'S ARTICLE "SCIENCE FALSELY SO CALLED" PUBLISHED IN THE SIGNS OF THE TIMES, NOVEMBER 6, 1884, THAT WHEN SHE USED THE TERMS "PHRENOLOGY," "MESMERISM," AND "ANIMAL MAGNETISM" IN 1862 SHE DID SO IN RATHER A LOOSE AND ALL-INCLUSIVE WAY, AS REFERRING TO THOSE SCIENCES WHICH "PERTAIN TO THE HUMAN MIND," FOR SO THEY WERE CONSIDERED AT THAT TIME.
